short_description: Discover Bahrain, a modern island nation in the Persian Gulf blending ancient history with contemporary luxury. Experience the Formula 1 Grand Prix, explore ancient Dilmun sites, enjoy world-class shopping and dining, and discover the rich cultural heritage of this Gulf state.

health.tap_water_safety: Safe to drink - Bahrain has excellent desalinated water
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 21
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed hotels, restaurants, and some stores
Public consumption of alcohol is restricted, but available in licensed venues

tipping.hotels: Tipping is appreciated for porters (1-2 BHD per bag) and housekeeping (2-5 BHD per day)
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10-15% tip is customary for good service, though service charge may be included
tipping.taxis: Tipping is appreciated, rounding up is common

weather.title: Bahrain has an arid climate with hot, humid summers and mild winters. The country experiences very little rainfall and high temperatures during the summer months, with more pleasant weather from November to March.

when_to_visit.title: Winter
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild and pleasant temperatures perfect for outdoor activities, sightseeing, and exploring the country. Ideal weather for visiting historic sites, shopping, and enjoying cultural attractions. Best time for Formula 1 Grand Prix in March

when_to_visit.title: Spring & Autumn
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm temperatures with increasing humidity. Still comfortable for most activities, but be prepared for warmer weather. Good time to visit before or after the peak summer heat

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Extremely hot and humid conditions with temperatures often exceeding 40¬∞C (104¬∞F). Not ideal for outdoor activities during the day. Best to stay indoors or in air-conditioned spaces, with activities in early morning or evening

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Bahrain is during the winter months from November to March when the weather is mild and pleasant, making it ideal for exploring historic sites, shopping, outdoor activities, and cultural attractions
